relation: Unique identifier for the file to be deleted
A filter, if any, to be applied
If 0, execute a hard (permanent) delete. For any value other than 0, perform a soft delete (see "Deletion Operations").

TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {351=The following constants are useful for declaring paths and item names. Paths are limited to 1024 characters and item names are limited to 256 characters.}
textBeforeTable: Table 47-26 DELETECONTENT Procedure Parameters Parameters principal IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL); soft_delete IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT NULL, filter IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, contentID IN RAW, store_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.DELETECONTENT (  Syntax  This procedure deletes the file specified by the given contentID. DELETECONTENT Procedure      FEATURES_T Table Type Return Values     Feature set featureSet Description Parameter Table 47-25 DECODEFEATURES Function Parameters Parameters RETURN FEATURES_T DETERMINISTIC PIPELINED; featureSet IN INTEGER) DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.DECODEFEATURES (  Syntax  Given a feature bit set integer value, this function returns a FEATURES_T table of the feature bits as FEATURE_T records. DECODEFEATURES Function       File system user for whom the access check is made principal
textAfterTable: DELETEDIRECTORY Procedure This procedure deletes a directory. If recurse is nonzero, it recursively deletes all elements of the directory. A filter, if supplied, determines which elements of the directory are deleted. Syntax  DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.DELETEDIRECTORY ( path IN VARCHAR2, filter IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, soft_delete IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT NULL, recurse IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, store_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, principal IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL); Parameters Table 47-27 DELETEDIRECTORY Procedure Parameters Parameter Description path Name of path to the directory filter A filter, if any, to be applied soft_delete If 0, execute a hard (permanent) delete. For any value other than 0, perform a soft delete (see "Deletion Operations"). recurse If 0, do not execute recursively. Otherwise, recursively delete the directories and files below the given directory.
